intro: Mycelis sagittarioides, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread vegetatively through underground stems. Its flowers are typically green with a white spathe, and it produces small, yellow berries. Mycelis sagittarioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
